text:
Question 05) I TEND THE MOBILE NOW LIKE ANJURED BIRD WE TEXT, TEXT, TEXT OUR SIGNENT WORDS.
I Re-Read Your First, Your Second, Your Third, Look for Your Small XX, Feeling Absurd.
The Codes We Send Arrive with a Broken Chord.
I Try to Picture Your Hands, Their image is blurred.
Nothing My Thumbs Press Will Ever Be Heard.
In this poem, the lyrical self highlights a feeling of
A) Contentment with virtual interaction.
B) zeal with sending messages.
C) Concern with the composition of texts.
D) hurt with someone's behavior.
E) dissatisfaction with a form of communication. Questions from 01 to 05 (Option: Spanish)
